content: Yudong Chen Search Yudong Chen Associate Professor Department of Computer Sciences, University of Wisconsin-Madison I am an Associate Professor in the Department of Computer Sciences at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. My research interests include machine learning, reinforcement learning, optimization, and high-dimensional statistics. Some of the topics that I am recently interested in are: reinforcement learning theory, non-convex and nonsmooth learning problems, stochastic optimization and approximation. My research has been recognized by an NSF CAREER Award, the Vilas Associates Award, and paper awards from ACM SIGMETRICS, INFORMS, and the Applied Probability Society. Previously I was an associate professor with tenure in the School of Operations Research and Information Engineering (ORIE) at Cornell University. Before that I was a postdoc in the EECS Department at the University of California, Berkeley. I obtained my Ph.D. in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the University of Texas at Austin. I received my B.S. and M.S. in Automation from Tsinghua University. News Our paper on LoRA-One is accepted to ICML 2025 for Oral presentation. Congratulation to Yuanhe! Matthew Zurek receives a Cisco Systems Distinguished Graduate Fellowship (4/25/2025)! I am selected for the Vilas Associates award. Our paper on average-reward MDP is the winner for the 2024 INFORMS Applied Probability Society Best Student Paper Prize. It is also accepted to NeurIPS 2024 for Oral presentation. Congratulation to my student Matthew Zurek! Our work on RL with low-rank structure received the Best Student Paper Award from ACM SIGMETRICS 2023. Congratulation to my student Tyler Sam!
